lines.text: I do this in the name of sports-watching, romantically-minded men; a maligned, misunderstood minority.
You didn't come to see me to make a decision. You came to me because you didn't like the decision you'd already made.
I've heard you British guys are all gentleman. You are British aren't you?
English actually.

[to Martha]
You are coming to London because it's 99 dollars?
Really Frank, if you can't afford it stay at home. It really is embarrassing.
My perfect partner is me.
You?
Yeah, me... with breasts.
Of course I wasn't alright. I'd just been knocked unconscious and now an American, who'd never driven a stick shift, was driving my car down the wrong side of the road.

[to Laurence about Daniel]
I didn't know he wore khaki trousers.
[Making up after their fist fight]
This is what women feel like when they give birth.
Yeah, except my hand kind of hurts.

[to Frank]
I'm a little bit older than six. The only people interested in you are six year old girls.
Everyone has sex on aeroplanes.
When I get nervous, I never say anything. I just sit there and get uptight.
In finding the right person you need someone with all the right similarities, yet all the right differences. Someone to read your mind instinctively, yet cover your weaknesses.
And one of the rooms they called it the library and they filled it full of books. Thousands of books on every subject and they're all second-hand. You know why?
It was cheaper?
No. It's so it looks like they've been read.

[of his professionally decorated flat]
I have the home of a widely-read, widely-travelled, deeply interesting man with taste.
And that's not you.
No.

[raising an eyebrow]
Not even the interesting bit?
There's nothing more boring than looking at paintings. Only reason anyone ever comes to an art gallery is to get laid.

[seeing the entrance to Laurence's flat]
Wow, this is great. In my apartment, I'd have to walk up 16 stories. The elevator works okay, but it's strictly for drug deals and contract fellatio.
